programme.title: The World God Only Knows
programme.desc: Still angry with Keima, Ayumi is dismayed when she must work with him after he is made the 2B Class Cafe barista; Keima attempts to talk to her, but her anger and Chihiro's presence make it difficult.

programme.title: The World God Only Knows
programme.desc: Keima asks Ayumi to meet him at Kozue River; Haqua explains to Chihiro why it is important that Keima makes Ayumi fall in love with him.

programme.title: The World God Only Knows
programme.desc: Keima asks Ayumi to meet him at Kozue River; Haqua explains to Chihiro why it is important that Keima makes Ayumi fall in love with him.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Young Love on the Run; Between a Rock and a Hard Place
programme.desc: The fate of the world rests with a skirt-chasing teenager called Ataru Moroboshi; a love-struck Oni alien princess Lum comes between Ataru and Shinobu.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Present for You; The Yellow Ribbon of Happiness
programme.desc: Sakura's crazy exorcism ritual does Ataru more harm than good; Ataru gets more than he bargained for when he uses power-dampening yellow ribbons on Lum.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Trouble Rains Down!!; Amazed in a Maze
programme.desc: Shutaro becomes the apple of every girl's eye and, by extension, a prick to every boy; Lum, Ataru, Shinobu and Shutaro struggle to find a way out of a labyrinthine cave.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.desc: Ataru and Shutaro emerge as potential mates for the crow aliens' very own sleeping beauty. While one steals the customary kiss, the other captures her heart simply by being in the right place at the right time.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: The Glove of Love and Conflict; How I've Waited for You...
programme.desc: A cursed boxing glove sends Ataru on a hugging spree and gets him into trouble; Ataru is dancing on air after reading a love letter from a secret admirer.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Good Day for a Departure; Oyuki; Ataru Retires
programme.desc: Playing for the Oni aliens, Ataru sets his flirtatious sights on Benten from the rival team; Ataru has a snowy encounter with Lum's Neptune-based friend, Oyuki; Ataru's vague announcement sparks wild speculations.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Home Is Where You Find It; Marine Garbage Disposal
programme.desc: All Ataru wants is Sakura in his arms, but all he gets is a lonely monster holding his hands underwater; an unexpected new beginning awaits the lonely monster at the beach.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Transfer Student Close Call...; Farewell Party Close Call...
programme.desc: Lum's vindictive friend Ran intends to use a clueless and kissy-faced Ataru to settle an old score; Ataru goes to Ran's party like a lamb to the slaughter.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: To Kill With Love; Studying Mayhem
programme.desc: Overloaded with good looks and physical strength, an old flame comes back into Lum's life to wreak havoc; Shutaro loses the spotlight at school.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Mendo Siblings!!; A Strange New Year at the Mendo Estate
programme.desc: The impish Ryoko Mendo scares the bejesus out of Ataru and gets on Shutaro's nerves; Ataru and his friends are in for a tumultuous New Year's celebration.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Mendo Siblings!!; A Strange New Year at the Mendo Estate
programme.desc: The impish Ryoko Mendo scares the bejesus out of Ataru and gets on Shutaro's nerves; Ataru and his friends are in for a tumultuous New Year's celebration.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Ten Is Here; A Date for Just the Two of Us
programme.desc: Lum's cousin Ten thinks Lum should look for greener romantic pastures; if Lum can't see reason, Ten will destroy her relationship with Ataru.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: The Great Off-Campus Snack Battle; A Gift from Ten!!
programme.desc: The girls in class aren't the only snacks Ataru has his eye on; when teachers crack down on off-campus snacking, a no-holds-barred snack battle begins.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: That Mizunokoji Boy; Love Letter Trouble
programme.desc: A showdown on the baseball diamond; once the dust settles, a letter stirs up trouble.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Anko Pathos, the Taste of Love?!; Memories and a Close Call...; Adverse Effects
programme.desc: Lum checks up on Ran's progress in winning Rei's heart; Lum and Ran discuss an event that happened in the past; Sakura creates love potions for Shinobu and Lum.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.desc: Ataru and his friends were supposed to have a fun beach trip, but they find themselves swept up in Ryunosuke's family drama.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: A Chest Full of Longing!!; Wish Upon a Star
programme.desc: Ryunosuke teams up with three delinquents to help Shinobu ward off an unwanted suitor; Ataru's family must be careful what they wish for.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Indelible Lipstick Magic!!; Lethal Attacks: Yaminabe!
programme.desc: There is nothing suspicious about the lipstick Lum wants to put on Ataru; Ataru's class takes the dreaded Yaminabe food challenge.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Magic Realm! Jungle of Terror; Pickled
programme.desc: Pro tip: never hurt an octopus feelings and never give an oni pickled plums.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.desc: Sugar, Ginger and Pepper challenge Benten.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Cosmo Teacher CAO-2; Ooh, Scary! Voodoo Doll
programme.desc: Lum and her friends worry the past will come back to haunt them; Mendo's life becomes much more complicated thanks to a voodoo doll.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.sub-title: Big Bottle, Little Bottle; When Love Strikes
programme.desc: Lum is quite the handful, no matter what size she is; a shapeshifting fox takes a liking to Shinobu.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura
programme.desc: The finalists have different motives; Lum wants Atarus attention, Ran wants to get in Lums way, Shinobu and Sakura want the money, and Ryunosuke has something to prove.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi, an assistant producer, faces the struggles of working within the anime industry.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Segawa-san falls ill and the pressure to complete episode four increases for Aoi -- and the director has decided to completely redo a scene!

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi and the team scramble to make their deadline after a server goes down and they can't access the necessary files.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Shizuka auditions for a role with Prussia Studio and learns that a popular voice actress is auditioning as well.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.sub-title: Those Who Blame Others Should Just Quit!
programme.desc: Endou-san drops out as animation supervisor for the eighth episode and the storyboards for the final episode are nowhere near finished.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Endo-san refuses to return to work and is offered a position at Studio Canaan and Aoi is forced to tell Honda about everything.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi's sister suddenly decides to visit; Ochiai announces he'll be leaving the company; Ema begins to question her animation skills.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Ema continues to struggle and Yumi offers her a new perspective; Aoi's troubles over Ochiai's announcement grow.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.sub-title: What Do You Think I Was Trying to Say?
programme.desc: Misa and Shizuka worry about their careers.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi is tasked with delivering an instrument to the sound effects department; Misa contemplates quitting her job and Aoi gives her some advice.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: The deadline for the last episode is fast approaching and Aoi needs to distribute the key frames to the animators.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: When Aoi apologizes to Kanno for asking for his help with the key frames, he tells her that there is someone perfect for the assignment.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.sub-title: What Kind of Cloud Do You Like?
programme.desc: Musashino Animation's next project is announced and Aoi is assigned to the production desk.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.sub-title: The No Holds Barred Audition Meeting!
programme.desc: While auditioning for a part, Shizuka is asked to read for another character; Seiichi attends the casting meeting.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: After welcoming the new employees, Musashino Animation dives into production for Third Aerial Girls Squad; Aoi's hard work may come to screeching halt.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Yumi revises the character designs based on the author's feedback, however his disapproval continues.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.sub-title: Can You Please Tell Me Where I Am?
programme.desc: The announcement of the anime adaptation for "The Third Girls Aerial Squad" is met with skepticism and the studio is forced into quickly completing a promotional video.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Ookura agrees to work on a scene with Aoi but forgets the next day; Musashino receives the layouts for the fifth episode.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi cracks under the pressure of Erika's return and asks her to take over; Erika visits the Taitanic office to sort things out.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Hiraoka implies that Midori is getting writing projects because she's a girl and argues with the director.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Aoi receives complaints from Segawa, who wants Hiraoka taken off the episodes she is working on.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Yumi nominates Ema to join Rinko as an assistant general animation supervisor.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: Seiichi reaches out to Nogame to try to settle the anime's ending; the Chazawa's lack of action comes to light.

programme.title: Shirobako
programme.desc: All that is left to do is deliver the final tapes to the TV stations, but Aoi's delivery may not make it in time.

programme.title: Farming Life in Another World
programme.desc: Hiraku won't waste his second chance at life and decides he will focus on what truly matters; he builds a new home with his own two hands.
